intro: Jatropha bahiana var. genuina, commonly known as the Brazilian physic nut, is a shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant features yellow flowers and red, three-lobed fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
